multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: rates; US inflation, Fed policy, and Treasury yields drive mortgage rate dynamics and influence borrowing costs.

category.motivation: The article provides commentary on mortgage rates and market expectations for Fed policy, rather than reporting a specific macro event, data release, or policy statement.

impact.motivation: The article provides updated mortgage rate levels and Fed policy expectations that directly influence the mortgage rates node, offering new data and outlook for the near term.

time_frame.motivation: The article discusses medium-term expectations for mortgage rates and Fed policy through 2025‑2026.

article_node.title: Mortgage and refinance interest rates today, September 2, 2025: Good time of year to buy
article_node.summary: Mortgage rates are flat but have been falling over the last month, with the 30‑year at 6.41% and the 15‑year at 5.55%. The Fed has cut rates in 2024 but has held them in 2025, and an 87% chance of a September cut could keep rates steady. Buyers are advised to shop lenders early, consider 15‑year terms or ARMs for lower rates, and weigh refinancing options. Market expectations suggest rates will remain above 6% through 2025, with limited drops in 2026.
